alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 22 at 11:37PM CDT until March 23 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Bibb, Dallas, Marengo, Perry and Shelby. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1137 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated bands of rainfall associated with showers and thunderstorms. Although the heaviest rainfall has moved east of the area additional rainfall will exacerbate ongoing flooding of creeks, streams, and low lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brent, Marion, Centreville, Linden, Uniontown, Jefferson, Vance, West Blocton, Thomaston, Sweet Water, Myrtlewood, Faunsdale, Dayton, Vaiden, Marion Junction, Heiberger, Bogue Chitto, Central Mills, Consul and Mertz.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
